title: £700,000 flood relief work resumes at Y Felinheli
article: Work is due to resume on a £700,000 flood relief scheme which was put on hold because of the coronavirus pandemic. Gwynedd council said contractors would use social distancing practices to allow the work to protect homes and businesses to start at Y Felinheli. "Flooding caused byStorm Ciara highlights the need for enhanced flood protection to the area," said Gwynedd councillor Catrin Wage. It is expected to finish in September.
